comments:
When selecting an existing class within the Package Explorer view of the Java
Perspective, then pressing Ctrl+C followed by Ctrl+V, and error occasionally
occurs. The error message says that paste did not operate normally and suggests
referring to the log. The error detail is: java.lang.NullPointerException

The log contains the following entries:

Tom,

any detailed steps to reproduce. And which VM are you using. NPE sometime point
to JIT problems.

What is strange is that the enablement check returns true (which actually checks
that the ReorgCopyStarter can be created) however when executed the starter
can't be created anymore.

Dirk,

I haven't been able to figure out steps to reproduce the error, though I have
seen it occur more than once. Immediately after it last occured I was able to
copy+paste the Java class without producing an error by following the same steps
(select file in package explorer, Ctrl+c then Ctrl+v).

Here are details of my JVM:

java version "1.4.2_04"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_04-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_04-b05, mixed mode)

Markus, it seems that this occurs during paste of a new cu.
Can you have a look?

Tobias: it's not paste of a text that creates a CU, but a normal copy-paste of a CU. The TextPaster is only available in HEAD, not in 3.1.1.

The only reason I can think of besides a VM problem is this:
We call getClipboardJavaElements(..) in canPasteOn(..) and then in paste(..) again.

If some system extension has modified the clipboard in between, then the paste action could fail.

Tom, do you have a clipboard enhancer or something like that running (IIRC, MS Office has such a multi-clipboard that retains old clips)? Or are you using eclipse on a remote computer (via e.g. VNC)?

I use MS Windows XP and some applications such as MS Outlook 2003 and MS Word do provide a multi-clipboard. However, this does not seem to be available within other applications, like text editors, etc.

I saw this problem again earlier in the week on someone else's system. He runs Eclipse 3.1.1 using Java 1.5.0_05 on Windows XP. Here is the log excerpt and session data from his system. I think the log is probably identical, but I haven't checked it closely.

I am unable to reproduce this problem with a 3.1.1 installation. As mentioned in comment 4, clipboard changes theoretically could cause the paste action to fail. But this does not explain the spurious NPE.
The code is protected against empty clipboard contents. There is no possibility of an NPE in JavaElementAndResourcePaster#paste.

Closing as works for me. Please reopen if you can provided detailed steps using a concrete project.

>  There is no possibility of an NPE in JavaElementAndResourcePaster#paste
Yes, there is a possibility. The line looks like this:
  ReorgCopyStarter
    .create(clipboardJavaElements, clipboardResources, (IJavaElement)destination)
    .run(getShell());

The call to ReorgCopyStarter.create(..) returns null if the arguments are not OK.
*** Bug 205965 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Added some logging to help tracking this down > I20071009-2225
